title: Tal - a numbers font I'm working on
content:
I'm creating a new font because I needed some numbers for an app and couldn't find any free font that I was satisfied with.

It's inspired by Handbook, DIN and the like.

The letters all have same the width as I need that for the interface I'm creating:)

Will probably open source it when done.

Hoping to hear your feedback so I can improve it.

I've created the thinnest, regular and black from scratch - the rest are just interpolated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/minfontdemo_5415.png)
author: andreaslarsen

comments.content:
I think it’s looking good for the purpose. A couple of annotations:  
- Even if it’s a geometric design, I think you should address the top-heaviness of the |8|, since you already made other optical adjustments like overshot.  
- Personally I find the heaviest weight a bit jarring in the open glyphs.  
- Not a fan of the bump in |6| and |9| either, where the stem joins the loop.

@riccard0

thx for the feedback!

Top-heaviness. I'll will try to correct it but still have the geometric feeling  
Jarring. Jep, wasn't happy with the heaviest weights either - also something I'll try to fix.  
Bump. Not sure what you are referring to?

Perhaps “bump” isn’t the right word… “Stiff bend” maybe?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/minfontdemo_5415_5499.png)

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tal_4680.png)

The stiff bend isn't actually any stiffer than the rest of the circle but I've tried to remove it + fix the top heaviness + close 2+3+5 a bit more.

Also fixed the 7 being too thin, and made the top on 1 a bit longer.

Thank you very much for your suggestions - feel the looks has improved but always room for more :)
Better overall. Perhaps the top inner cusp of the bottom counter of |5| could be moved a bit to the left.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317115742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tal2_4271.png)

Moved it a liiiiiitle bit...more and it took away the heaviness of the character...
